intro: Brassica luteola, commonly known as wild mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and broccoli. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The seeds are small and contained within siliques, which are the characteristic pod-like structures of the family.
